posts.post_content:
Opponent: "I reveal [Terminus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminus) and cast it for its miracle c--"  
  
![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol): "No."  
  
Isn't it weird that angel Aurelia's signature spell is the only reliable way in Standard to stop angel spells from getting cast for their angel cost? :)  
  
...it's also weird that Wizards has been so crude about their countermeasures lately -- [Frontline Medic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Frontline Medic), [Ash Zealot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ash Zealot), [Angel of Jubilation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angel of Jubilation), etc. White/Red have gotten dumped on with poorly tacked-on countermeasure abilities lately, but Aurelia's Fury feels awesome, natural, and cohesive! Huge improvement.
posts.html:
Opponent: "I reveal Terminus and cast it for its miracle c--"

: "No."

Isn't it weird that angel Aurelia's signature spell is the only reliable way in Standard to stop angel spells from getting cast for their angel cost? :)

...it's also weird that Wizards has been so crude about their countermeasures lately -- Frontline Medic, Ash Zealot, Angel of Jubilation, etc. White/Red have gotten dumped on with poorly tacked-on countermeasure abilities lately, but Aurelia's Fury feels awesome, natural, and cohesive! Huge improvement.

posts.post_content: The jury's still out on this one. I think most people agree that it's good... but how good is still questionable. To those wondering, this card will almost always have some utility to the current board state. [Fireball](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fireball) was a great card for it's time and this is more useful and instant speed. It will probably settle around $15 mythic.
